project_description: A simple Flutter application that toggles between displaying 'Cat' and 'Dog' text with respective icons when clicked.
architecture_overview: This Flutter project follows a modular architecture with a clear separation between UI, state management, and business logic. The Cubit pattern is used for managing state.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant HomeScreen
participant AnimalCubit
participant AnimalState
User -> HomeScreen: Click Animal Text
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: Update State
AnimalState -> HomeScreen: Notify State Change
HomeScreen -> User: Update Display
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. When the user clicks on the animal text, the HomeScreen widget calls the toggleAnimal method of the AnimalCubit. The Cubit then updates the AnimalState, which notifies the HomeScreen to rebuild and display the updated animal.
navigation_flow: The application has a single screen (HomeScreen) which is displayed when the app is launched. There is no additional navigation structure.
